Posted By: novasun (8/27/2010 2:08:53 PM)

posts.post_content:
This creature is so awesome, really want to get him. but why people complain about one side being good and the other not, I think the point of a "two card for one creature" thing is, that if it were just one card, then it'll be stupidly powerful and everyone with a black deck will get one, hell, people without black will put it in their decks just to have it. also, if you gave it trample or reach or something like that, again, it would be too powerful. Plus anything that blocks it, except darksteel and regenerating creatures, will die, and your opponent has to do that with 3 creatures.  
Eldrazi based decks won't be able to stop this thing. He attacks you, what a shame, you sacrifice other cards, you attack him, either he blocks and loses 3 of his precious eldrazi, or he dies. **SIMPLE AS!**  
  
Basically, if you want to really kick ass with it, equip darksteel plate and whispersilk cloak, then your opponent will never be able to get rid of it. \*Evil Planning\*
posts.html:

Plus anything that blocks it, except darksteel and regenerating creatures, will die, and your opponent has to do that with 3 creatures.

Posted By: Pentavite625 (9/26/2012 12:12:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is NOT the scariest creature I have ever seen. That title goes to Emrakul, who has haste (via extra turn), Flying, proxies himself (via extra turn), untaps all lands you control (via extra turn), is uncounterable and can be killed by almost nothing. The fact that one hit from him makes you sacrifice 6 permanents really never makes a difference in the game since that's usually enought to finish you.  
  
This guy dies to every type of removal, is nearly impossible to play, requires a second cost to get out, and can still be chump-blocked by anything with deathtouch. The fact that he costs 15 of one color means that there's a very small chance of ever giving him useful abilities like trample and haste too.
posts.html:
This is NOT the scariest creature I have ever seen. That title goes to Emrakul, who has haste (via extra turn), Flying, proxies himself (via extra turn), untaps all lands you control (via extra turn), is uncounterable and can be killed by almost nothing. The fact that one hit from him makes you sacrifice 6 permanents really never makes a difference in the game since that's usually enought to finish you.

This guy dies to every type of removal, is nearly impossible to play, requires a second cost to get out, and can still be chump-blocked by anything with deathtouch. The fact that he costs 15 of one color means that there's a very small chance of ever giving him useful abilities like trample and haste too.
